bestIdea.name: The Northwest Passage
bestIdea.description: A historic sea route through the Arctic Ocean, connecting the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans. This treacherous path is known for its icy waters and was sought after for centuries as a potential trade route.

otherIdeas.name: Fridtjof Nansen's Fram Expedition
otherIdeas.description: Follow the path of the famous Norwegian explorer Fridtjof Nansen, who attempted to reach the North Pole by allowing his ship, the Fram, to be trapped in the Arctic ice and drift with it.

otherIdeas.name: The Polar Express
otherIdeas.description: A magical journey to the North Pole, inspired by the classic children's book and film. Traverse through snowy landscapes and icy terrains to reach Santa's workshop.

otherIdeas.name: Roald Amundsen's South Pole Expedition
otherIdeas.description: Trace the route of Roald Amundsen, the first person to reach the South Pole. Experience the harsh conditions and strategic planning that led to this historic achievement.
